title: Replace Tugboat page main content with reusable Tema fleet JSON tugboat list

requirements.text: Create a reusable TugboatList component that renders ALL tugboats from the provided Tema fleet JSON (port/authority/fleet_last_updated plus tugboats array) and displays each tugboat’s full details: id, name, IMO number, year built, type, specifications (bollard pull tonnes, gross tonnage, length, beam, max draught, engine power when present), capabilities, status, and last_maintenance when present.

quotes: within this box and all similar Tugboat page create and display all the following tugboats : json file

acceptanceCriteria: A new reusable React component exists (e.g., under frontend/src/pages/tugboats or frontend/src/components) that takes Tema fleet JSON data and renders all 6 tugboats from the user-provided JSON.
Each tugboat card/row shows: id, name, IMO number, year built, type, status, and a clearly labeled section for specifications and capabilities.
Optional fields (e.g., engine_power_kw, last_maintenance) are rendered when present and omitted (without blank placeholders) when absent.

requirements.text: Replace ONLY the content within the selected Tugboat page elements (XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1] and its first paragraph /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[1]) with the new TugboatList output, so the page shows all results properly without leaving the old placeholder paragraph content.

quotes: start building to show all results properly
The user has selected the following 2 elements from the page for context. ... The user instructions should be applied ONLY to the elements selected in this prompt.

acceptanceCriteria: The Tugboats page no longer renders the previous fleet overview paragraph/content within the selected <main> area; it renders the TugboatList instead.
All 6 tugboats from the provided JSON are visible on the Tugboats page with responsive layout (works on mobile and desktop without overflow).

requirements.text: Make the TugboatList component automatically reusable across tugboat-related pages by integrating it wherever tugboat fleet results are displayed (at minimum, the /tugboats route page), using the same shared component rather than duplicating markup.

quotes: yes same tugboat‑list component automatically repeated on every tugboat‑related page

acceptanceCriteria: The /tugboats route uses the shared TugboatList component.
No duplicated tugboat list rendering logic remains in TugboatsPage; it delegates to the shared component.
If other tugboat-related pages need a fleet list in the future, the component can be imported and used without modification.

requirements.text: Store the provided Tema fleet JSON in the frontend codebase as a dedicated data source (static JSON/TS module) and render from it (not from backend getAllTugboats), ensuring the UI matches the provided JSON fields (e.g., IMO number, capabilities, gross tonnage, beam, max draught).

quotes: Which JSON file should be used to populate the tugboats? Please provide it or its structure.

acceptanceCriteria: A static frontend data file/module contains the exact provided JSON structure/values.
The TugboatList renders from this static data and shows fields that are not available in the current backend Tugboat type (e.g., IMO number, capabilities).
No backend changes are required to display the tugboats from the provided JSON.

constraints: Apply changes ONLY within the selected elements: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1] and /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[1]/p[1].
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
nonGoals: Do not implement CRUD editing of tugboats.
Do not add new authentication providers (Internet Identity remains the only supported auth).
Do not add real-time updates or WebSocket features.
Do not redesign non-tugboat pages outside the selected <main> area.
